answerText: context-free grammar [10] Any context-free grammar that does not produce the empty string can be converted into an equivalent context-free grammar in this simpler form, named for the linguist who augmented context-free grammars with generative rules in order to more closely model human language.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC Los Angeles B and Iowa | 19 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: While they less frequently involve infinite tapes and beavers, there are elements of formal languages that are less powerful than Turing machines. Identify the following,  [10] Expressed as a set of non-terminal symbols, a set of terminal symbols, a finite set of mappings from symbol to symbol, and a start symbol, this recursive construction is key to parsing theory. The set of all strings of terminal symbols generated by applying the mappings to the start symbol is the eponymous language of one of these.
